alert.note: Alert for Eastern Bergen; Eastern Essex; Eastern Passaic; Eastern Union; Hudson; Western Bergen; Western Essex; Western Passaic; Western Union (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 23 at 9:51AM EST by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...Rapidly falling temperatures with gusty winds, and falling wind chills... A strong Arctic cold front is expected to move through the region from around Noon to 1 PM EST. The front will be accompanied with briefly heavy showers, possibly with lightning, and strong gusty winds of 40 to 50 mph. Southerly winds will shift to the west and Arctic cold will begin to move into the region, with westerly winds 20 to 30 mph and gusting 40 to 45 mph. Temperatures will rapidly drop, as much as 15 to 20 degrees in just a few hours, and will fall below freezing early this afternoon, and wind chills will be in the single digits to around 10 above zero by late afternoon. If venturing outside be prepared for the rapidly changing conditions, and dress appropriately. Another concern is any standing water may become black ice late this afternoon into the early evening hours.
